column4: I can't import photos from my camera unless I'm root, but the fact that the import wizard comes up anyway makes me think that this is a bug -- does anybody have ideas as to a fix?
I do.
lay it on me. :-)
go to console, plug the camera in and do "lsusb", then look if your camera is detected.
lsusb reports my camera and my three empty ports
Now look in /etc/udev/rules.d/45-libgphoto2.rules for a line that contains both those hexadecimal numbers.
There actually must be 2 lines in that file for each camera.
very nice, let me take a look at that
still there? it appears that there is no entry for my camera, but I'm not sure
Yes, exactly. Well, you have to add it manually. Just make 2 lines looking the same as others, only with your camera's numbers.
why 2 lines?
Then restart udev (sudo /etc/init.d/udev restart) and replug the camera.
it seems that all the other cameras have only 1 line.
They have 2 lines each on my system, but if one is enough on yours, you can try it this way.
on your system, is it one line right after another?
Yes, it is. Report in if the solution works, because there's one more bug on this, and I'll guide you through that fix as well.
worked perfectly.
Then you got my congratulations! Just be aware, there is one more issue on this, and it can emerge on your system after some update.
I filed a bug on launchpad, https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libgphoto2/+bug/91250 -- you may check it out to be prepared.
The solution is also there.
thanks a bunch for the fix info, hope the launchpad bug gets resolved.
